# Useful links
* Technical issues brought up during lecture can often be found in the [class discussions](discussion.html)
* Some ideas on setting up your machine are [here](useGit.html)
* Introduction to `tibble` can be found [here](http://r4ds.had.co.nz/introduction-2.html) and [here](http://r4ds.had.co.nz/tibbles.html)
* A nice discussion on `tibble` vs. `data.frame` is [here](https://www.jumpingrivers.com/blog/the-trouble-with-tibbles/)
* Wiki pages for [sign test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sign_test) and [Wilcoxon signed-rank test](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wilcoxon_signed-rank_test).
* Wiki page for [Kolmogorovâ€“Smirnov statistic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kolmogorov%E2%80%93Smirnov_test) that looks at the supremum of the set of distances.
* A [paper](https://www.jstor.org/stable/2988087?seq=1#metadata_info_tab_contents) on 2 by 2 contingency table, fixed margin tests vs random margin tests.
* A [paper](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3546387/) on generating survival times to simulate Cox proportional hazards models with time-varying covariates.
